claim.text: Y-NQ is a newly released dataset that enables to compare generative open-book reading comprehension between English and Yorùbá.
claim.exact_quote: Y-NQ is a newly released dataset that enables to compare generative open-book reading comprehension between English and Yorùbá.

evidence.evidence_text: Y-NQ is a newly released dataset that enables to compare generative open-book reading comprehension between English and Yorùbá.
evidence.exact_quote: Y-NQ is a newly released dataset that enables to compare generative open-book reading comprehension between English and Yorùbá.

claim.text: The main contributions of our data set are to allow for the comparison of LLM results in a reading comprehension task across a high- and a low-resource language, showing what are the generalization capabilities of LLMs in this particular case.
claim.exact_quote: The main contributions of our data set are to allow for the comparison of LLM results in a reading comprehension task across a high- and a low-resource language, showing what are the generalization capabilities of LLMs in this particular case.

evidence.evidence_text: The main contributions of our data set are to allow for the comparison of LLM results in a reading comprehension task across a high- and a low-resource language, showing what are the generalization capabilities of LLMs in this particular case.
evidence.exact_quote: The main contributions of our data set are to allow for the comparison of LLM results in a reading comprehension task across a high- and a low-resource language, showing what are the generalization capabilities of LLMs in this particular case.

claim.text: Our experiments show that the reading comprehension capabilities of current English LLMs do not extend to Yorùbá.
claim.exact_quote: Our experiments show that the reading comprehension capabilities of current English LLMs do not extend to Yorùbá.

evidence.evidence_text: Our experiments show that the reading comprehension capabilities of current English LLMs do not extend to Yorùbá.
evidence.exact_quote: Our experiments show that the reading comprehension capabilities of current English LLMs do not extend to Yorùbá.

claim.text: Y-NQ allows us to evaluate how reading comprehension capabilities extend to Yorùbá.
claim.exact_quote: Y-NQ allows us to evaluate how reading comprehension capabilities extend to Yorùbá.

evidence.evidence_text: Y-NQ allows us to evaluate how reading comprehension capabilities extend to Yorùbá.
evidence.exact_quote: Y-NQ allows us to evaluate how reading comprehension capabilities extend to Yorùbá.

claim.text: Y-NQ is not exactly comparable in its totality between languages.
claim.exact_quote: Y-NQ is not exactly comparable in its totality between languages.

evidence.evidence_text: Y-NQ is not exactly comparable in its totality between languages.
evidence.exact_quote: Y-NQ is not exactly comparable in its totality between languages.

claim.text: Given that Yorùbá has shorter documents than English, the reading comprehension task is easier for Yorùbá.
claim.exact_quote: Given that Yorùbá has shorter documents than English, the reading comprehension task is easier for Yorùbá.

evidence.evidence_text: Given that Yorùbá has shorter documents than English, the reading comprehension task is easier for Yorùbá.
evidence.limitations: Assumes that document length is the only factor affecting reading comprehension difficulty.
evidence.exact_quote: Given that Yorùbá has shorter documents than English, the reading comprehension task is easier for Yorùbá.

evaluation.key_limitations: Assumes that document length is the only factor affecting reading comprehension difficulty.

claim.text: Therefore, results on this language should be much better than in English to expect parity between languages.
claim.exact_quote: Therefore, results on this language should be much better than in English to expect parity between languages.

evidence.evidence_text: Therefore, results on this language should be much better than in English to expect parity between languages.
evidence.limitations: Assumes that the reading comprehension task is the only factor affecting LLM performance.
